page.title: 08RIVER OTTER
page.content: The river Otter usually flows quietly from its source in the Blackdown Hills to the sea at Budleigh Salterton.There have been occasional floods, the worst being in July 1968. During a period of 10 minutes on the night of July 10/11 the heavy rainfall caused the water level to rise by 1.30m. The bridges at Fenny Bridges and Tipton St John were swept away but St Saviours bridge at Ottery and Cadhay and Gosford bridges withstood the flood. Much damage was caused particularly to the Ottermill Swichgear factory and the houses nearby. Island Farmhouse was flooded. The water reached chest height in the downstairs rooms. The entire stock of timber of Ottery Sawmills was swept downstream. Twelve caravans on the caravan sitewere swept away and five motorists were trapped at Cadhay.
